MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant. Here are exceptions to this rule: 1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted. 2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of init_response_body_data: ```c static int init_response_body_data (void) { if (0 != body_dyn_size) { body_dyn = (char *) malloc (body_dyn_size); if (NULL == body_dyn) { fprintf (stderr, "Failed to allocate memory.\n"); return 0; } if (tool_params.medium) { /* Fill the body with HTML-like content */ size_t pos; size_t filler_pos; static const char body_header[] = "\n" "\nSample page title\n\n" "\n"; static const char body_filler[] = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
\n"; static const char body_footer[] = "\n" "\n"; pos = 0; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_header, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header)); pos += MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header); for (filler_pos = 0; filler_pos < (body_dyn_size - (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header) + MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer))); ++filler_pos) { body_dyn[pos + filler_pos] = body_filler[filler_pos % MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_filler)]; } pos += filler_pos; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_footer, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer)); } else { /* Fill the body with binary-like content */ size_t pos; for (pos = 0; pos < body_dyn_size; ++pos) { body_dyn[pos] = (char) (unsigned char) (255U - pos % 256U); } } } return ! 0; } ``` Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c for (pos = 0; pos < body_dyn_size; ++pos) ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
scenario: Not violated. The controlling expression is `pos < body_dyn_size`, and `pos` is modified by the loop increment (`++pos`), so the expression is not invariant. (A violating scenario would be if the loop did not change any variable in the controlling expression or used a constant controlling expression — e.g. `for (pos = 0; 10 > 0; ++pos)` or if the increment were missing so the expression never changes.)
